{"step_by_step_thinking": "Idiopathic cholestasis of pregnancy is characterized by pruritus and biochemical cholestasis, including raised serum bile acids and usually elevated aminotransferases levels. The documents mention that serum bilirubin can be elevated, as well as serum alkaline phosphatase. SGPT, also known as ALT, can also be elevated. However, there is no mention of a prolongation of prothrombin time being associated with idiopathic cholestasis of pregnancy.", "answer_choice": "D"}
